prDescription: Create/Edit/Delete agents dynamically via UI modal with version tracking

tasks.title: Define stored agent storage interface
tasks.description: Create the base storage interface for stored agents with CRUD operations and versioning support. This is the foundation for all agent storage implementations.
steps: Define StoredAgent type with id, name, description, modelId, providerId, systemPrompt, tools, etc.
Define AgentVersion type with versionId, agentId, config snapshot, createdAt, description
Create IStoredAgentStorage interface with: create, get, getAll, update, delete methods
Create IAgentVersionStorage interface with: createVersion, getVersions, getVersion, restoreVersion methods
Export types and interfaces from index.ts
acceptanceCriteria: StoredAgent type includes all necessary agent configuration fields
AgentVersion type captures full agent state for restoration
Interfaces support async operations with proper error handling
Types are exported and can be imported from @mastra/core

tasks.title: Implement in-memory stored agent storage
tasks.description: Create the in-memory implementation of the stored agent storage interface for development and testing.
steps: Implement CRUD operations using Map or array storage
Implement version creation with automatic snapshot of agent config
Add proper error handling for not found cases
acceptanceCriteria: All CRUD operations work correctly
Versions are created with timestamps and unique IDs
getVersions returns versions sorted by creation date
restoreVersion correctly updates agent with historical config

tasks.title: Add stored agent methods to Mastra class
tasks.description: Extend the Mastra class to support stored agents alongside code-defined agents.
steps: Add storedAgentStorage property to Mastra configuration
Implement getStoredAgent(id) method that retrieves and instantiates agent from storage
Implement getStoredAgents() method that returns all stored agents
Ensure stored agents can use tools registered with Mastra
acceptanceCriteria: Stored agents can be retrieved and used like code agents
Stored agents have access to Mastra-registered tools
Methods properly propagate storage errors
getAgent() can resolve both code and stored agents

tasks.title: Create stored agents API handler
tasks.description: Implement the server-side CRUD API endpoints for stored agents.
steps: Create Zod schemas for stored agent request/response validation
Implement GET /api/stored-agents - list all stored agents
Implement GET /api/stored-agents/:id - get single stored agent
Implement POST /api/stored-agents - create new stored agent
acceptanceCriteria: All endpoints return proper HTTP status codes
Request validation rejects invalid payloads with clear errors
Response schemas match TypeScript types
OpenAPI spec is generated correctly

tasks.title: Create agent versions API handler
tasks.description: Implement the server-side API endpoints for agent version management.
steps: Create Zod schemas for version request/response validation
Implement GET /api/stored-agents/:id/versions - list versions for agent
Implement POST /api/stored-agents/:id/versions - save current state as version
Add proper error handling for invalid agent/version IDs
acceptanceCriteria: Versions are listed in reverse chronological order
Version details include full agent configuration snapshot
Restore creates a new version with restored config
Proper 404 errors for non-existent agents/versions

tasks.title: Register stored agent routes
tasks.description: Wire up the stored agent and version handlers to the server router.
steps: Create stored-agents.ts route file with route definitions
Create agent-versions.ts route file with route definitions
Register routes in the main routes index
Ensure routes are included in OpenAPI documentation
Add appropriate route tags for API organization
acceptanceCriteria: Routes are accessible at expected paths
Routes appear in OpenAPI/Swagger documentation
Route middleware (auth, validation) is applied correctly

tasks.title: Create agent form validation schema
tasks.description: Define Zod validation schema for the agent creation/edit form.
steps: Define agentFormSchema with all required fields
Add validation for name (required, min length)
Add validation for description (optional, max length)
Add validation for model selection (required provider + model)
Add validation for system prompt (optional, max length)
Export schema and infer TypeScript type
acceptanceCriteria: Schema validates all agent configuration fields
Error messages are user-friendly
TypeScript type is correctly inferred from schema

tasks.title: Create model picker components
tasks.description: Build the model picker UI for selecting AI provider and model.
steps: Create useModelPicker hook to manage provider/model state
Fetch available providers from API or config
Create ModelSelect dropdown that filters by selected provider
acceptanceCriteria: Provider dropdown shows all available providers
Model dropdown filters based on selected provider
Selected values are properly controlled via form state
Loading states show appropriate feedback

tasks.title: Create agent form component
tasks.description: Build the main form component for creating/editing agents.
steps: Add tools selector (multi-select from available tools)
Handle form submission with onSubmit callback
acceptanceCriteria: Form displays all agent configuration fields
Validation errors show inline below fields
Form can be pre-populated for edit mode
Submit button is disabled during submission

tasks.title: Create stored agents React Query hooks
tasks.description: Build React Query hooks for fetching and mutating stored agents.
steps: Create useStoredAgents hook for listing agents
Create useStoredAgent(id) hook for single agent
Configure proper cache invalidation on mutations
acceptanceCriteria: Hooks properly fetch and cache agent data
Mutations invalidate relevant queries
Loading and error states are exposed
TypeScript types are correctly inferred

tasks.title: Create agent versions React Query hooks
tasks.description: Build React Query hooks for agent version management.
steps: Create useAgentVersions(agentId) hook for listing versions
Create useAgentVersion(agentId, versionId) hook for single version
Ensure version list refreshes after save/restore
acceptanceCriteria: Versions are fetched and cached correctly
Save version creates new entry and refreshes list
Restore version updates agent and creates new version
Error states are properly handled

tasks.title: Create agent creation dialog
tasks.description: Build the modal dialog for creating new agents.
steps: Create CreateAgentDialog component using Dialog from UI library
acceptanceCriteria: Dialog opens and closes correctly
Form submission creates agent via API
Success closes dialog and shows notification
Errors display in dialog without closing

tasks.title: Create agent edit dialog
tasks.description: Build the modal dialog for editing existing agents.
steps: Create EditAgentDialog component accepting agent prop
Pre-populate AgentForm with existing agent data
Optionally prompt to save version before editing
acceptanceCriteria: Form is pre-populated with agent configuration
Changes are saved via PUT API call
Version can be saved before making changes
Success shows notification and closes dialog

tasks.title: Create agent delete confirmation dialog
tasks.description: Build the confirmation dialog for deleting agents.
steps: Create DeleteAgentConfirm component with agent name prop
Display warning message about permanent deletion
Show loading state on Delete button
acceptanceCriteria: Warning message shows agent name
Cancel closes dialog without action
Delete calls API and shows loading state
Success closes dialog and shows notification

tasks.title: Create agent versions list component
tasks.description: Build the UI for displaying agent version history.
steps: Create AgentVersionsList component accepting agentId prop
Use useAgentVersions hook to fetch versions
Display versions in a list with timestamp and description
Add 'View' button to see version details
Add 'Compare' button to compare with current
Handle empty state when no versions exist
acceptanceCriteria: Versions display in reverse chronological order
Each version shows timestamp and description
Restore triggers confirmation and API call
Empty state shows helpful message

tasks.title: Create save version dialog
tasks.description: Build the dialog for saving a new agent version.
steps: Create SaveVersionDialog component with agentId prop
Add description input field for version notes
acceptanceCriteria: Dialog allows entering version description
Save creates new version with description
Success notification shows version created
Dialog closes and version list refreshes

tasks.title: Create version comparison dialog
tasks.description: Build the dialog for comparing agent versions.
steps: Create VersionCompareDialog accepting two version IDs
Create JsonDiffModal component for visual diff
Highlight added, removed, and changed fields
acceptanceCriteria: Side-by-side comparison shows both versions
Differences are highlighted with colors
Can restore to either version from dialog
Large configs are scrollable

tasks.title: Update agents page with stored agents
tasks.description: Modify the agents page to display and manage stored agents.
steps: Fetch both code agents and stored agents
Display stored agents in a separate section or with badge
Add 'Create Agent' button that opens CreateAgentDialog
Add Edit and Delete actions to stored agent cards
Add 'Versions' action to view version history
Ensure stored agents can be selected for chat
acceptanceCriteria: Page shows both code and stored agents
Stored agents are visually distinguished
CRUD actions work for stored agents
Stored agents can be used in chat interface

tasks.title: Implement PostgreSQL stored agent storage
tasks.description: Create PostgreSQL implementation of stored agent storage.
steps: Implement all CRUD operations with SQL
Handle JSON serialization for config fields
acceptanceCriteria: All storage interface methods implemented
Tables created with proper schema
Queries are parameterized (SQL injection safe)
JSON fields properly serialized/deserialized

tasks.title: Implement LibSQL stored agent storage
tasks.description: Create LibSQL implementation of stored agent storage.
acceptanceCriteria: All storage interface methods implemented
Compatible with LibSQL/Turso
JSON stored as TEXT and parsed correctly
Timestamps handled correctly

tasks.title: Implement MongoDB stored agent storage
tasks.description: Create MongoDB implementation of stored agent storage.
acceptanceCriteria: All storage interface methods implemented
Documents stored with proper structure
Queries use indexes effectively
ObjectId handled correctly

tasks.title: Create client SDK stored agent resource
tasks.description: Add stored agent methods to the JavaScript client SDK.
acceptanceCriteria: All methods call correct API endpoints
TypeScript types match server responses
Error handling for API failures
Methods are documented with JSDoc

tasks.title: Add client SDK stored agent tests
tasks.description: Write tests for the stored agent client SDK resource.
steps: Set up test mocks for HTTP client
Test list() returns array of agents
acceptanceCriteria: All methods have test coverage
Mocks verify correct API calls
Error scenarios are tested
Tests pass in CI

tasks.title: Verify build and typecheck pass
tasks.description: Ensure the complete PR builds and passes type checking.
steps: Run pnpm build from monorepo root
Run pnpm typecheck from monorepo root
Verify no regressions in existing functionality
acceptanceCriteria: pnpm build completes without errors
pnpm typecheck completes without errors
No TypeScript strict mode violations

tasks.title: Run and fix affected package tests
tasks.description: Run tests for all packages modified in this PR and fix failures.
steps: Run pnpm test:core for core package
acceptanceCriteria: All existing tests pass
No regressions in test coverage
New code has reasonable test coverage

tasks.title: Manual end-to-end testing
tasks.description: Manually test the complete feature flow in the playground.
steps: Start playground with pnpm dev in packages/playground
Create a new agent via UI modal
Edit the agent and save changes
Verify edit creates a new version
acceptanceCriteria: All CRUD operations work in UI
Version history shows all changes
Version comparison displays diff correctly
Restore updates agent to previous state
Delete removes agent permanently
